markdown:
<title level="1" pfs="">[Venom Caller](/Monsters.aspx?ID=1628)</title>

<row gap="medium">

<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">

Venom callers are [zyss serpentfolk](/Monsters.aspx?ID=798) spellcasters that specialize in the use of acid and poison magic, viewing them as natural extensions of their inherent venom. They have a reputation for bold action, something that puts them at odds with other zyss who prefer stealth and subterfuge. When a venom caller can't eliminate their rivals to seize control of their colony, they often leave in a dramatic demonstration of arrogance, insisting that slithering in shadows does the serpentfolk cause no favors.

 Though venom callers aren't considered subtle by their kin, their schemes—which often revolve around acquiring rare magical lore—can nevertheless take humanoid communities by surprise. Venom callers often lure away unsuspecting victims, murder them, and disfigure their venom-wracked bodies with acid; the venom caller then assumes the victim's form. Authorities, believing all members of the community are accounted for, assume the unrecognizable corpse must have been a traveler. Most venom callers have broken with other serpentfolk communities and have no qualms about murdering their kin or infiltrating other serpentfolk cells if it serves their purposes.

<column gap="tiny">
**[Recall Knowledge - Humanoid](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**
([Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=14)): DC 25

**[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 23

**[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 20
</column>

</column>

<column gap="medium">
<image src="/images/Monsters/Serpentfolk_Venomcaller.png" />
</column>

</row>

<title level="2" right="Creature 7">[Serpentfolk Venom Caller](/Monsters.aspx?ID=1628)</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="NE" url="/Rules.aspx?ID=95" />
<trait label="Medium" />
<trait label="Humanoid" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=91" />
<trait label="Serpentfolk" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=307" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Pathfinder #170: Spoken on the Song Wind](/Sources.aspx?ID=97) pg. 87</row>

**Perception** +15; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=12), [scent](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=33) (imprecise) 30 feet

**Languages**
[Aklo](/Languages.aspx?ID=13), [Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Draconic](/Languages.aspx?ID=2), [Undercommon](/Languages.aspx?ID=11); [telepathy](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=37) 100 feet

**Skills**
[Arcana](/Skills.aspx?ID=2) +17, [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=5) +15, [Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=10) +15, [Occultism](/Skills.aspx?ID=11) +17, [Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=14) +15, [Survival](/Skills.aspx?ID=16) +15

<row gap="medium">
**Str** +0

**Dex** +4

**Con** +2

**Int** +6

**Wis** +4

**Cha** +2
</row>

**Items**
[Shortbow](/Weapons.aspx?ID=77) (20 arrows), [Sickle](/Weapons.aspx?ID=9)

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="medium">
**AC** 24 

**Fort** +13 

**Ref** +15 

**Will** +17 (+4 status vs. [mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=106))

+1 status to all saves vs. magic
</row>

**HP** 105

**Resistances**
[poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=126) 10

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

**Speed** 25 feet

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
fangs +16 ([Finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179)),
**Damage** 2d8+4 piercing plus serpentfolk venom

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
sickle +16 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179), [Trip](/Traits.aspx?ID=196)),
**Damage** 1d4+4 piercing plus serpentfolk venom

**Ranged**
<actions string="Single Action" />
shortbow +16 ([deadly d10](/Traits.aspx?ID=174), [range increment 60 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=248), [reload 0](/Traits.aspx?ID=254)),
**Damage** 1d6+4 piercing plus serpentfolk venom

**Arcane Spontaneous Spells** DC 25, attack +17
- **Cantrips (4th)**
[Acid Splash](/Spells.aspx?ID=3), [Detect Magic](/Spells.aspx?ID=66), [Mage Hand](/Spells.aspx?ID=177), [Read Aura](/Spells.aspx?ID=246), [Shield](/Spells.aspx?ID=280)
- **1st**
[Feather Fall](/Spells.aspx?ID=111), [Item Facade](/Spells.aspx?ID=166), [Magic Missile](/Spells.aspx?ID=180) (3 slots)
- **2nd**
[Acid Arrow](/Spells.aspx?ID=2), [False Life](/Spells.aspx?ID=108), [Invisibility](/Spells.aspx?ID=164) (3 slots)
- **3rd**
[Mind Reading](/Spells.aspx?ID=194), [Slow](/Spells.aspx?ID=289), [Stinking Cloud](/Spells.aspx?ID=309) (3 slots)
- **4th**
[Acid Arrow](/Spells.aspx?ID=2), [Noxious Vapors](/Spells.aspx?ID=704) (2 slots)

**Occult Innate Spells** DC 25
- **1st**
[Ventriloquism](/Spells.aspx?ID=356) (at will)
- **2nd**
[Mirror Image](/Spells.aspx?ID=197) (at will)
- **3rd**
[Illusory Disguise](/Spells.aspx?ID=159) (at will)
- **4th**
[Suggestion](/Spells.aspx?ID=315)

**Serpentfolk Venom**  ([Poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=126)) **Saving Throw** DC 23 Fortitude; **Maximum Duration** 6 rounds; **Stage 1** 1d4 poison damage and [enfeebled 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=13) (1 round); **Stage 2** 2d4 poison damage and enfeebled 1 (1 round)

**Venom Pool** <actions string="Two Actions" /> ([Arcane](/Traits.aspx?ID=11), [Conjuration](/Traits.aspx?ID=33), [Poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=126)) **Frequency** once per day; **Effect** The venom caller conjures a 10-foot burst of liquid poison within 60 feet. Each creature that begins its turn in the area takes 4d6 poison damage (DC 25 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Fortitude save). On a critical failure, creatures also take 1d6 [persistent poison damage](/Conditions.aspx?ID=29). Once per turn, starting the turn after the venom caller uses Venom Pool, the venom caller can use a single action, which has the [concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=32) trait, to increase the radius of the burst by 5 feet. The pool of venom lasts for 1 minute, at which time it evaporates without a trace.

</column>

<document level="2" id="creature-family-151" />
name: Serpentfolk Venom Caller

Though venom callers aren't considered subtle by their kin, their schemes—which often revolve around acquiring rare magical lore—can nevertheless take humanoid communities by surprise. Venom callers often lure away unsuspecting victims, murder them, and disfigure their venom-wracked bodies with acid; the venom caller then assumes the victim's form.
